Program

  • Monday April 18th, 2016
  • UC Davis Conference Center

    Tabare Abadie, Opening remarks

    Paul Bilinski, Five years of the UCD Plant Breeding Symposium...in 5 minutes

    Jill Farrant, Resurrection plants as models for production of extremely drought tolerant crops

    10:20
    Poster Access, Coffee
    10:50
    Jean-Luc Jannink, To breed for stress resilience, start with a resilient crop: genomic selection in cassava

    11:50
    Ryan Graebner, GeneticSubsetter: an efficient, user-friendly R package for identifying informative core sets of germplasm collections (Student Talk)
    12:10

    13:40

    15:00
    Poster Access, Coffee
    15:30

Register

*Event is free and open to the public. See program for event details. Attendance (live or webinar) requires registration (lunch and memorabilia provided to first 200 registrants).
UPDATE (April 13th, 2016): Online registration is now closed. On-site registration is still available on the day of the event but lunch is guaranteed for pre-registered attendees only.
